snippet: Under a plan, equipment left over from a spy satellite program would be used to investigate dark energy and locate planets beyond the solar system.
abstract: John Grunsfeld, NASA associate administrator for space science, announces plans to use equipment left over from spy satellite program to investigate dark energy and locate planets beyond the solar system; if the plan succeeds, it could shave hundreds of millions of dollars and several years off a quest that many scientists say is the most fundamental of our time and that NASA has said it cannot undertake until 2024.
lead_paragraph: Under a plan, equipment left over from a spy satellite program would be used to investigate dark energy and locate planets beyond the solar system.

headline.seo: Ex-Spy Telescope May Become a Space Investigator
headline.main: Ex-Spy Telescope May Get New Identity as a Space Investigator
headline.print_headline: Ex-Spy Telescope May Get New Identity as a Space Investigator
